intro: Kaluhaburunghos ferrugineus, commonly known as the rusty burr plant, is a shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its rough, bark-like leaves that are typically covered in a reddish-brown or rusty-colored pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. Its fruits are dry, three-lobed capsules that release seeds when mature. Kaluhaburunghos ferrugineus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
